title: Apple.Logic.Pro.X.MACOSX-REMEDY
description:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          Apple.Logic.Pro.X.MACOSX-REMEDY
                 --------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-----------------------Uploaded on TPB by Akun / ABOD Studios----------------------
               _______________________________________________________


Description :


Logic Pro X introduces an advanced yet intuitive new interface designed for pro musicians, a ton of inspiring new plug-ins and sounds, and more powerful tools that keep the creative process flowing.

Advanced Design
A powerful new interface lets the music-making process flow freely while also giving musicians more creative control than ever. Simple controls let you get great results quickly, with easy access to the full range of advanced tools for the most demanding professional workflows.

Inspring Sounds
Virtual session drummers. Highly detailed, realistic drum kits. Coveted bass amps and cabinets. Even more stompboxes. New vintage synths and keyboards. A sophisticated arpeggiator. Put more than you ever imagined into your music.

Powerfull Tools
Logic Pro X gives you even faster, smarter ways to create your songs Ã¢â‚¬â€ and perfect them. Now you can fine-tune notes in a vocal performance long after you recorded it. Shape sounds in multiple ways by turning a single knob. And dive into thousands of entirely new sounds to spark your imagination.

                ____________________________________________________



THIS IS THE MAC OSX VERSION ( Works on OSX 10.8.4+ )
If you have problems with prior versions to osx 10.8.4 I can't provide you support.
                                               
                ____________________________________________________



Instructions:


-Mount or burn the image
-Install.
-Enjoy !

NOTE 

For 10.7 owners and below, you could try editing the info.plist file and the LSMinimumSystemVersion value - supposedly that should work. 
(but If you have problems with prior versions to osx 10.8.4 I can't provide you support.)

                ____________________________________________________
